definition: Soviet Union, 1922-1991/abbr. for Union of Soviet Socialist Republics (USSR) 蘇維埃社會主義共和國聯盟|苏维埃社会主义共和国联盟[Su1 wei2 ai1 She4 hui4 zhu3 yi4 Gong4 he2 guo2 Lian2 meng2]
surname Su/abbr. for Soviet Union 蘇維埃|苏维埃 or 蘇聯|苏联/abbr. for Jiangsu province 江蘇|江苏/abbr. for Suzhou city 蘇州|苏州
Perilla frutescens (Chinese basil or wild red basil)/place name/to revive/used as phonetic in transliteration
to ally/to unite/to join/(poetry) antithetical couplet

pinyin: Su1 lian2 Zui4 gao1 Su1 wei2 ai1

sentences.english: They could even count the fruit in Soviet orchards and analyze their crops.
sentences.chinese: 他们甚至可以数出苏联果园里的果树并分析其产量。

sentences.english: Reshetnikov was a celebrated Soviet pilot who fought on the Eastern Front in World War II.
sentences.chinese: 列舍特尼科夫是2战中东线战线的著名苏联飞行员。

sentences.english: The USSR was so proud of the synchrophasotron.
sentences.chinese: 苏联是如此为这个加速器而自豪。

sentences.english: A Soviet naval base near Murmansk helped the Nazi attack on Norway.
sentences.chinese: 苏联摩尔曼斯克一处海军基地协助纳粹攻击挪威。

sentences.english: The Russian Oyster Mushroom is an edible variety that belongs to she Shimeji family.
sentences.chinese: 苏联平菇属于姬菇科中可食用的一种。

sentences.english: Hammer and sickle symbols of the industrial worker and the peasant are used as the emblem of the ussr .
sentences.chinese: 代表产业工人和农民的锤子镰刀图案用作前苏联国徽。

sentences.english: Soviet Reactors can be overcharged, but will cause it to take damage.
sentences.chinese: 苏联的反应堆可过量充电，但会受损。

sentences.english: But the pragmatists were saying this is good for China.
sentences.chinese: 但是现实主义者说苏联解体对中国是有利的。

sentences.english: The Sukhoi SU-22 is a robust and effective Soviet built ground attack aircraft.
sentences.chinese: 苏22是前苏联建造的一种威力强大的对地攻击战机。

sentences.english: Gas deposits were first identified in Yamal during Soviet times.
sentences.chinese: 亚马尔的天然气首先是在苏联时期得到确认。

sentences.english: The name of the Russian astronaut who performed this feat was Leonov.
sentences.chinese: 建立这一功绩的苏联宇航员名叫雷诺夫。

sentences.english: Experts have expressed dismay at the quixotic Soviet-style project.
sentences.chinese: 专家们对这一不切实际的苏联式工程项目表示失望。

sentences.english: And Russia is making up for past humiliations after the collapse of the USSR.
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯在洗刷前苏联瓦解之后所蒙受的屈辱。

sentences.english: The war would have ended in a clear-cut victory for the Soviet-supplied Arab forces.
sentences.chinese: 战争就会以苏联支持的阿拉伯部队明显地获胜而结束。

sentences.english: They all signed "mutual assistance" pacts making them virtual protectorates of the Soviet Union.
sentences.chinese: 他们都签署了使自己几乎受制于苏联的“互惠条约”。

sentences.english: In the former Soviet Union, corruption scandals can spark usurpation.
sentences.chinese: 在前苏联，腐败丑闻可引发篡权。

pinyin: Jie2 ke4 Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4

definition: Nikita Khrushchev (1894-1971), secretary-general of Soviet Communist Party 1953-1964
Allies/entente (i.e. Western powers allied to China in WW1)
Leningrad, name of Russian city Saint Petersburg 聖彼得堡|圣彼得堡 1923-1991
Soviet Communist Party/abbr. for 蘇聯共產黨|苏联共产党[Su1 lian2 Gong4 chan3 dang3]
